item.title: Coronavirus: UK records more than 40,000 deaths
item.description: Health Secretary Matt Hancock says it is "a time of sorrow for us all" as the UK reaches 40,261 deaths.

item.title: George Floyd death: Matt Hancock urges UK public to avoid protests
item.description: Matt Hancock says people should stick to rules as protests are planned over the African American's death.

item.title: Coronavirus: Your tributes to those who have died
item.description: A collection of your tributes to some of the thousands of people in the UK who have died with coronavirus.

item.title: Madeleine McCann: New suspect also investigated over missing German girl - reports
item.description: The man was investigated over the disappearance of a five-year-old girl in 2015, German media reports.

item.title: George Floyd: Reddit co-founder quits board and asks for black replacement
item.description: Alexis Ohanian says the move was inspired by protests over the death of George Floyd.

item.title: Coronavirus: Ban on landlords evicting renters extended
item.description: No-one will be evicted from their home this summer, Housing Secretary Robert Jenrick says.

item.title: Arctic Circle oil spill: Russian prosecutors order checks at permafrost sites
item.description: Russian prosecutors order checks at sensitive installations built on permafrost after a huge oil spill.

item.title: Biden: Trump 'despicable' for invoking George Floyd
item.description: Mr Trump said the slain African American man was "looking down" and "saying this is a great day".

item.title: Florence Eshalomi: Black MP mistaken for colleagues condemns racism
item.description: Florence Eshalomi says the frequency she is confused with black female MPs is "worrying".

item.title: Coronavirus: Isle of Wight MP admits lockdown 'barbecue' visit
item.description: Tory Bob Seely says he did not know other people would be present when he visited a journalist.

item.title: Beach marshals to stop repeat of Dorset coastal influx
item.description: Tens of thousands of people have flocked to the Dorset coast since lockdown restrictions were eased.

item.title: Lady Gaga's Chromatica is the fastest-selling album of 2020
item.description: The star's sixth album, Chromatica, outsold the rest of the Top 10 combined to debut at number one.

item.title: Samoan rugby team that set off 104 days ago still not home
item.description: While waiting for flights to resume, 20 players shared a single room in Auckland for three months.

item.title: Coronavirus: Kate Garraway opens up on husband's battle with 'evil virus'
item.description: TV presenter Kate Garraway's partner has been in a coma for nearly 10 weeks, after catching Covid-19.

item.title: George Floyd: How the USA's history has shaped today's police brutality
item.description: The BBC's Clive Myrie looks at the toxic combination of racism and inadequate police training.

item.title: Quiz of the Week: What did the crew name their spaceship?
item.description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

item.title: UK zoos at risk of closure
item.description: The Covid crisis is putting the survival of one of the UK's largest zoos at risk.

item.title: Coronavirus: The body collectors of Brazil
item.description: Brazil has seen high numbers of coronavirus deaths and ordinary people are trying to help cities cope.

item.title: From cats to cakes: The photo that made me
item.description: Members of the Association of Photographers select a picture that kick-started their career.

item.title: Alan Partridge to return with podcast from Norwich shed
item.description: The 18-part series will be recorded from the fictional Norwich-based broadcaster's shed.

item.title: Coronavirus and poverty: Is there a link?
item.description: Why poorer people are more likely to catch - and die from - Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown wildlife recordings appeal
item.description: Scientists want people to send them recordings of their wildlife experiences under the lockdown.

item.title: Norway landslide: Buildings swept away in Alta disaster
item.description: Watch as land continues to collapse during the rescue effort.

item.title: 'We're all still grieving' - care home staff on impact of virus
item.description: Care home staff from the charity MHA look back at the impact of the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: Gaming 'hero' retires at 23 due to ill-health
item.description: Jian Zihao says physical and mental health problems have caused him to quit e-sports.

item.title: Madeleine McCann: What is known about the German suspect?
item.description: Named as Christian B, 43, the man currently in jail has many previous convictions.

item.title: George Floyd: Five pieces of context to understand the protests
item.description: All the background that helps explain why these protests are happening, and why now.

item.title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: The older doctors risking their lives to battle Covid-19
item.description: Though medical staff are in the Covid-19 firing line, there has been a surge of interest in healthcare as a career.

item.title: Coronavirus: Job-hunting advice for graduates, from the Class of 2008
item.description: We asked three people who hit the job market just as recession was biting, what got them through.

item.title: #WeAreTired: Nigerian women speak out over wave of violence
item.description: Thousands sign a petition and use the hashtag #WeAreTired to protest against recent rapes and killings.

item.title: Madeleine McCann: False turns and a final breakthrough?
item.description: After 13 years, the hunt for the missing three year old may be a step closer to a conclusion.

item.title: Is coronavirus changing the world of cleaning?
item.description: Hi-tech cleaning products are being offered to tackle coronavirus, but are they better than soap and water?

item.title: George Floyd death: China takes a victory lap over US protests
item.description: China is hitting back at the US for supporting Hong Kong pro-democracy demonstrations last year.

item.title: Sitting In Limbo: Brother turns Windrush scandal into a very personal TV drama
item.description: The brother of a man caught up in the Windrush scandal has written a BBC drama about his ordeal.

item.title: Coronavirus: Are protests legal amid lockdown?
item.description: Black Lives Matter protests continue in the UK - but are they illegal under restrictions on gatherings?

item.title: Home haircut fine is 'absolute joke' - Dortmund's Sancho
item.description: Jadon Sancho says it is an "absolute joke" he has been fined by the German football league after being pictured having a home haircut without a mask.

item.title: Rangers propose B teams next season in 14-14-18 Scottish league reconstruction
item.description: Rangers and Celtic would both have 'B' teams in the bottom tier of a 14-14-18 league set-up being proposed by the Ibrox club for next season.

item.title: BBC Radio 5 Live to broadcast at least seven games a week when Premier League returns
item.description: A minimum of seven games will be broadcast live every week on BBC Radio 5 Live when the Premier League returns later this month.

item.title: 'I have thoroughly enjoyed it' - Boycott leaves TMS after 14 years
item.description: Sir Geoffrey Boycott leaves Test Match Special, the 79-year-old saying the coronavirus pandemic had essentially made the decision for him.

item.title: BBC to show Bournemouth v Palace & Norwich v Everton as fixtures confirmed
item.description: The BBC is to broadcast Bournemouth v Crystal Palace on 20 June at 19:45 BST as the first of its four free-to-air games.

item.title: George Floyd death: Morgan Lake, Chris Lambert and Lianne Sanderson speak out
item.description: Morgan Lake, Chris Lambert and Lianne Sanderson speak about how they feel after the death of George Floyd.

item.title: Patrick Mahomes & Odell Beckham Jr among NFL players calling on league to condemn racism
item.description: NFL stars including Patrick Mahomes and Odell Beckham Jr have called on the league to "condemn racism and the systemic oppression of black people".

item.title: Coronavirus UK map: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus: Who should wear a face mask or face covering?
item.description: Face coverings are to become compulsory for people using public transport in England.

item.title: Coronavirus and face coverings: the correct way to wear them
item.description: Across the world, people are being asked to wear face coverings to help stop coronavirus from spreading.

item.title: Can I start a new relationship? And other questions
item.description: Starting a new relationship is difficult during the current crisis, but not impossible.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does contact tracing work in England?
item.description: People who have been in close contact with someone found to have Covid-19 are now being traced.

item.title: Coronavirus: Which schools are reopening for pupils?
item.description: Which children are the first to go back to school, and what about the rest?

item.title: Coronavirus: Could social distancing of less than two metres work?
item.description: The government is under pressure to relax the 2m social distancing rule - but is it safe to do so?

item.title: Coronavirus symptoms: What are they and how do I protect myself?
item.description: Loss of taste and smell have been added to the UK's list of coronavirus symptoms.

item.title: Coronavirus: What tests are being done in the UK?
item.description: What are the tests for coronavirus, who are they for and how do they work?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the UK travel quarantine rules?
item.description: What do you need to know if you're planning to fly during the Covid-19 pandemic?

item.title: NHS test & trace: Does contact tracing stop coronavirus?
item.description: Wales is the latest part of the UK to launch a tracing system, but how do they work?

item.title: Coronavirus: How dangerous is lifting lockdown?
item.description: Why is lifting restrictions being described as a "dangerous moment"?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are social distancing and self-isolation rules?
item.description: You can now meet more people and play certain non-contact sports in the UK - but what are they?

item.title: Coronavirus: Why we don't know how many are being tested
item.description: The UK Statistics Authority has criticised the government's handling of Covid-19 testing data.

item.title: Hay fever v coronavirus: what are the symptoms?
item.description: The Royal College of General Practitioners is warning people not to mix up the symptoms.

item.title: Coronavirus: When will shops open and what will the rules be?
item.description: Non-essential shops can reopen in England in June, but will I be able to buy a book or have a haircut?

item.title: Social distancing: A practical guide to how to socialise now
item.description: Meeting friends? Here's how to handle the awkward new rules - from sharing food to avoiding hugs.

item.title: Coronavirus: Parents shamed for back-to-school choices
item.description: Parents of year six and year one pupils have been falling out over whether to send them back to school.

item.title: Coronavirus: We answer kids' questions about going back to school
item.description: The BBC's Education Editor Branwen Jeffreys answers kids' questions about going back to school.

item.title: Coronavirus: School return plan 'like a jigsaw puzzle'
item.description: A head teacher explains how she is piecing school life back together before children return.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the risks for children?
item.description: Children seem to be at low risk from the disease, but can they still spread it?

item.title: Coronavirus: Who should be shielding?
item.description: People most at risk of needing hospital treatment if they get coronavirus are being asked to stay home.

item.title: Coronavirus: Are these targets being hit?
item.description: Ministers have set targets for testing, medical equipment and hospital beds. Have they delivered?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the rules on weddings?
item.description: There is a lot of uncertainty around when and how weddings are allowed to take place. What are your rights?

item.title: All you need to know about new measures
item.description: How will social and work life be different after the easing of some restrictions around the UK?

item.title: Coronavirus: How safe is it to get on a plane?
item.description: Many airlines are planning to resume flying, but they first need to reduce the risks of Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus: What does it mean if I've been furloughed by work?
item.description: Millions unable to do their job due to coronavirus will have their wages paid by a new scheme.

item.title: Coronavirus: What help are self-employed getting from government?
item.description: What is being done for the five million self-employed people in the UK facing a sudden loss of income?

item.title: A cluster of islands: How Shetland locked down early and stopped the virus in its tracks
item.description: Shetland was one of the UK areas worst hit by Covid-19 - now there have been no new cases for six weeks. How did they do it?
